snippet: The United States and Cuba have agreed to re-establish direct postal service, the latest progress in President Obama’s push to normalize relations.
abstract: United States and Cuba agree to lift restrictions and reestablish direct mail service, part of ongoing process of normalizing relations between two countries initiated by Pres Barack Obama.
lead_paragraph: The United States and Cuba have agreed to re-establish direct postal service, the latest progress in President Obama’s push to normalize relations.

headline.main: Cuba: Mail Flights From U.S. to Begin
headline.print_headline: The Americas; Cuba: Mail Flights From U.S. to Begin
